Javadoc documentation for ISB Java classes. ISBJava Home Page &mainGroup;, &mainAffiliation;
The ISBJava project is a library (collection) of classes written in the Java programming language, that are intended to be used for research in computational biology. The body of source code for these java classes is available by contacting the group:
&mainEmailSafe;
You will need the Sun Java Development Kit (JDK) vesrion 1.4 or newer (or the equivalent) in order to use these classes.
A few notes about conventions used these java packages. The ".tp" suffix at the end of a package name indicates that the ".tp" subpackage contains test programs for the parent package. Similarly, a suffix ".t" at the end of a package name indicates that the ".t" subpackage contains unit tests for the parent package (in the JUnit framework).
These classes are all in development, and are subject to change at any time, without notice. All classes contained herein should be considered copyright of the &mainAffiliation;, 2003. These classes have been tested on the Sun JDK v1.4.1, on the Red Hat Linux 8.0 platform. On other platforms, your mileage may vary.
Ant is required to use the "build.xml" file in this directory. You can download and install Ant from the apache Ant project. All builds must be initiated from inside the java directory (one level up from the java/src directory). The end products of the source code in this directory are:
Class files, stored in: CVSARCHIVE/bolouri/classes/isb/...
A JAR file in: CVSARCHIVE/bolouri/build/isb.jar
Javadoc documentation: <WEBDIR>/javadoc
Some of the packages in this source directory tree require external Java packages/libraries to be installed. In particular, in order to be able to compile the full source tree, you will need to have the following Java libraries installed and available within your CLASSPATH environment variable:
Package nameJAR nameSource
jfreechartjfreechart-<VERS>.jar www.object-refinery.com/jfreechart/
jcommonjcommon-<VERS>.jar www.object-refinery.com/jcommon/
SBW (core)SBWCore.jar www.sbw-sbml.org/sbw/software/
SBML ValidatorSBMLValidate.jar www.sbw-sbml.org/sbw/software/
Note that the SBW/SBML libraries and packages are only required for compiling the code in the "isb.chem.sbw" directory. By omitting this directory from the compilation (by adding a suitable "exclude" to the "javac" statements in the build.xml file), in principle the resulting isb.jar file that would be built, would not have any dependencies on the aforementioned SBW/SBML libraries.
